security_audit.summary: This is an official skill template with minimal content. No executable code or external integrations are present.

content.value_statement: You need a starting point for a new skill file. This template provides the required structure so you can fill in details quickly.
actual_capabilities: Provides a SKILL.md file scaffold with frontmatter
Includes name and description fields for metadata
Shows a heading area for instructions
Keeps content minimal for easy customization
limitations: No actual skill instructions are included
No automation or scripts are provided
No examples or test prompts are included

best_practices: Keep the description specific and trigger focused
Document clear steps in the instruction section
anti_patterns: Using vague descriptions that overlap other skills

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a generic SKILL.md template and works for both.

faq.question: Are there limits in this template?
faq.answer: It only provides a basic structure and no functional logic.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes, you can reference or combine it with other skill files.

faq.question: Does it handle user data?
faq.answer: No, it does not process or store any data.

faq.question: What if the skill does not trigger?
faq.answer: Ensure the description clearly states when it should be used.

faq.question: How does it compare to full skills?
faq.answer: This is a scaffold, while full skills include detailed workflows.
